intro: Eremogone saxatilis, commonly known as the rock sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and rocky environments in western North America. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are succulent and adapted to conserve water, typical of xerophytic species. Eremogone saxatilis thrives in well-drained soils and is often found on cliffs, slopes, and gravelly areas.
